io.sqooba.traildbj

Class TrailDBj.TrailDB

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.sqooba.traildbj.TrailDBj.TrailDB
  • Enclosing class:
    TrailDBj

    public static class TrailDBj.TrailDB
extends java.lang.Object
    Class used to query an existing TrailDB.
    Author:
    Vilya

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TrailDB(java.lang.String path)
      Construct a TrailDB on the given .tdb file.

      • getField

        public long getField(java.lang.String fieldName)
        Get the field ID given a field name.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - The field name.
        Returns:
        The corresponding field ID.
        Throws:
        TrailDBj.TrailDBError - if the specified field is not found.

      • getLexiconSize

        public long getLexiconSize(long field)
        Get the number of distinct values in the given field, +1 counting the empty string if not present.
        Parameters:
        field - The field ID.
        Returns:
        The number of distinct values.
        Throws:
        TrailDBj.TrailDBError - if the field index is invalid ( <=0 | > number of fields).

      • getFieldName

        public java.lang.String getFieldName(long fieldId)
        Get the field name given a field ID.
        Parameters:
        fieldId - The field ID.
        Returns:
        The corresponding field name.
        Throws:
        TrailDBj.TrailDBError - if the field id is invalid ( <=0 | > number of fields).

      • getItem

        public long getItem(long fieldID,
                    java.lang.String value)

        Get the item corresponding to a value. Note that this is a relatively slow operation that may need to scan through all values in the field.

        WARNING: the returned value maybe suffer overflow!

        Parameters:
        fieldID - The field ID.
        value - The value in the field.
        Returns:
        An item encoded in a long, which was casted from uint64_t.
        Throws:
        TrailDBj.TrailDBError - if no item is found.

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue(long field,
                                 long val)

        Get the value corresponding to a field ID and value ID pair.

        Calling with the empty string for val will result in an error.

        Parameters:
        field - The field ID.
        val - The value ID.
        Returns:
        The corresponding field value.
        Throws:
        TrailDBj.TrailDBError - if the returned value is too big for Java or not found in the db.

      • getItemValue

        public java.lang.String getItemValue(long item)
        Get the value corresponding to an item. This is a shorthand version of getValue().
        Parameters:
        item - The item.
        Returns:
        The corresponding field value.
        Throws:
        TrailDBj.TrailDBError - if the value was not found or the returned value is too big for Java.

      • getUUID

        public java.lang.String getUUID(long trailID)
        Get the UUID given a trail ID.
        Parameters:
        trailID - The trail ID.
        Returns:
        A raw 16-byte UUID.
        Throws:
        TrailDBj.TrailDBError - if the trailID is invalid i.e. less than 0 or greater than the number of trails.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If trailID is less than 0 or >= than the number of trails.

      • getTrailID

        public long getTrailID(java.lang.String uuid)
        Get the trail ID given a UUID.
        Parameters:
        uuid - A raw 16-byte UUID.
        Returns:
        The traild ID corresponding to uuid.
        Throws:
        TrailDBj.TrailDBError - if the UUID was not found.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If uuid is an invalid 32-byte hex string.

      • trail

        public TrailDBj.TrailDBCursor trail(long trailID)
        Get a cursor over a particular trail in the database. The cursor allows to iterate over the event in this trail.
        Parameters:
        trailID - The trail id.
        Returns:
        A cursor over the trail.
        Throws:
        TrailDBj.TrailDBError - If cursor creation failed in some way.

      • trails

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,TrailDBj.TrailDBCursor> trails()
        Get a map containing a trail UUID as key and a trail cursor as value, allowing to iterate over all trails in the database.
        Returns:
        A map containing a trail UUID as key and a trail cursor as value
